person.persName: Samuel Read Anderson (Nashville, Tennessee, soldier, bank cashier, and postmaster)

body.p: Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee, soldier, bank cashier, and postmaster. Virginia native. Son of Robert Anderson. Married to Susan Miller Anderson. Father of Robert Anderson. Married to Mary J. Parker Turner Anderson. Father of Mary E. Anderson. Married to Married to Susan Trousdale Allen in Shelby County, Tennessee, on February 13, 1856. Father of May Anderson and Aaron Brown Anderson. Served in the 1st Tennessee Infantry as lieutenant colonel in the Mexican-American War. Bank Cashier in Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Nashville in 1850. Appointed postmaster in Nashville in 1857. Postmaster in Nashville in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Nashville in 1860. Commissioned Brigadier in the provisional army of the Confederate States of America on July 9, 1861. Recommissioned Brigadier General on November 4, 1864. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on June 5, 1865.
